The legislation signed into law by Gover: 2011, requires employees to contribute higher payments towards their pension and health care benefits.
The health care contributions are phased: year period and are based on a percentage of one's premium, varying according to salaries and levels of coverage.
The new contribution levels took effect: while for workers under an existing contract, the payment levels and four-year time frame begin when their contract expires.
After the fourth year of implementation: the health care contributions can become part of union negotiations, indicating that collective bargaining for health benefits is not permanently eliminated.
